intro: Dissotis pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered dissotis, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dissotis pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
